item.title: Help please? [delta] 317
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

Ya,

String[] parts = data.split(",");

Instead of

String[] parts = data.split(" ");

And then you can remove the

parts[0].replace("_", " ");

So it would be: Hello World,3010

item.title: Help please? [delta] 317
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

You would have to split the line of date into multiple parts using

String.split();

and then having a space between each piece of data.
then you would have to parse the second part using

Integer.parseInt();

So your final code would look something like this:

public void Updatetxt() { try { BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("data/updates.txt")); String data = null; while ((data = in.readLine()) != null) { String[] parts = data.split(" "); parts[0].replace("_", " "); sendQuest(parts[0], Integer.parseInt(parts[1])); } } catch (IOException e) { System.out.println("Critical error while reading welcome message file!"); e.printStackTrace(); } }
With mine though, the string you would be sending would have to use _s instead of spaces (So Hello_World, instead of Hello World).

And your file would be like this:
Hello_World 4021

Read full topic

item.title: Help please? [delta] 317
item.dc:creator: @FusionLord FusionLord
item.description:
@FusionLord wrote:

ok i have this code that will read all the updates for the server.

public void Updatetxt()
    {
        try
        {
            BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(new FileReader("data/updates.txt"));
            String data = null;
            while ((data = in.readLine()) != null)
            {
                sendQuest(data);
            }
        }
        catch (IOException e)
        {
            System.out.println("Critical error while reading welcome message file!");
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }

but with the send quest it says:

Client.java:30: sendQuest(java.lang.String, int) in client cannot be applied to (java.lang.String)
                     sendQuest(data);

So my question is does anyone know how to make it auto assign the integer to the sendQuest

Read full topic
